data.text: @Batmaninatree95 @LisaBritton Exactly, they moved the industry while men were killing each other .

@LisaBritton My Grandmother, who was born in 1903, was a housewife & mother, but she was also in the ARP (Air Raid Patrol) during WW2, & as well as other things, had to help try & put out burning buildings that had been hit by incendiary bombs with a stirrup pump & bucket chain for water.
@LisaBritton Do you have a link to that study?? Very interesting!
@LisaBritton To little, to late. Ship them out and prove how “empowered” they really are.
@LisaBritton Too little too late, ladies. If you want to fight, you'll do it yourselves. Tootles!
@LisaBritton That’s the joke though. You’re just explaining it.
@Lstad78 @LisaBritton You mean't to say "equality for women would be to step up".

@LisaBritton Thus I feel bringing in women into combat roles of military and spending so much money and training time on them is such a waste. I have not come across one female who wishes to fight alongside our brothers at lower ranks, every one wants to be an officer only.
